questions.question_text: What is the result of voiding a payment?

choices.D: The payment is no longer valid.
choices.A: A stop payment request has been initiated to the bank.
choices.C: The payment is reconciled to the bank statement.
choices.B: A bills payable payment was created but is not yet matured.

discussion.content: D. The payment is no longer valid.

Correct Answer is E
https://docs.oracle.com/cloud/farel9/financialscs_gs/OCUAR/F1550147AN10063.htm#F380507AN105A7
Search: Financial Reporting Center: Explained
I THINK Correct answer is C

choices.C: Standard, Credit Memo, and Invoice Request
choices.A: Standard, Credit Memo and Debit Memo
choices.D: Standard, Debit Memo and Customer Refund

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Standard, Credit Memo and Debit Memo
Standard, Credit Memo and Debit Memo
A. Standard, Credit Memo and Debit Memo

questions.question_text:
During your business trip to the UK, you took a taxi ride and paid for it by using your personal Visa credit card. While entering your expenses, you get a warning that a different conversion rate was applied to the taxi expense by Visa that the one used by your company.
How do you handle this situation?

choices.B: Call Visa to address the issue and tell them to make adjustments to their conversion rate. Then, wait to get a revised statement.
choices.C: Overwrite the conversion rate with the one Visa provided and enter a justification that Visa used a different conversion rate.
choices.D: Use the corporate-defined conversion rate even if it means you will not be reimbursed fully.
choices.A: Do not enter the taxi expense and call your Finance Department so that they can make changes in the conversion rate settings and you do not violate the allowable limit.

discussion.content:
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/financials/20a/faiex/expense-policies-and-rules.html#FAIEX195657
Specifying a Conversion Rate Policy
You can define conversion rate behavior for each business unit in your company. These definitions enable you to enforce conversion rate policies and to validate the conversion rates that employees enter for foreign currency receipts. If you enter a conversion rate value in an expense report, or override a defaulted value, the value you enter is validated against the current conversion rate definitions.

Note: Conversion rate behavior applies only to cash expenses, not to corporate card expenses.
C. Overwrite the conversion rate with the one Visa provided and enter a justification that Visa used a different conversion rate.

choices.C: System will calculate error tolerance as Policy Rate * (1+Warning Tolerance+ Error Tolerance/100
choices.A: System will calculate error tolerance as (|Policy Rate * (1+Error Tolerance/100)|) currency precision.
choices.D: System will calculate warning tolerance as Policy Rate * (1+Warning Tolerance/100)
choices.B: System will calculate warning tolerance as Policy Rate * (1+Warning Tolerance/100)*currency precision.
choices.E: System will use absolute amount tolerance setup to do validations.

discussion.content:
Warning: A percentage is used to calculate a warning. The warning tolerance amount is calculated as follows:
Policy Rate * (1+Warning Tolerance/100)

Error: A percentage is used to calculate an error. The error tolerance amount is calculated as follows:
Policy Rate * (1+Error Tolerance/100)
D>B; Currency precision is included in warning tolerance calculation during the currency conversion
B. System will calculate warning tolerance as Policy Rate * (1+Warning Tolerance/100)*currency precision.

comments.content: Sorry, the correct answer is D
